item.title: Making it so you can only do a command once. [delta]
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Bobby Mr. Bobby
item.description:
@Mr_Bobby wrote:

all statements must be closed with a “;” so like

    return false

Wrong

    return false;

Right

item.source: Making it so you can only do a command once. [delta]

item.title: Making it so you can only do a command once. [delta]
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false;

This is a simple error. You’re returning something although the result type is void. (As in Null and void)

Example;

public void returnType() {
    return false;
}

Error’d ^

public void returnType() {
    return 153;
}

Error’d ^

public void returnType() {
    return;
}

^ Not error’d.

public boolean returnType() {
    return false;
}

^ Not error’d.

Read full topic
item.source: Making it so you can only do a command once. [delta]

item.title: Making it so you can only do a command once. [delta]
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“n00bf0rlyf3, post:3, topic:362274”]I get a compiling error. it says

cannot return a value from method whose result type is void return false; ^[/quote]

The problem is that not all paths through the code return a value.

item.title: Making it so you can only do a command once. [delta]
item.dc:creator: @Thetwistedsnake Thetwistedsnake
item.description:
@Thetwistedsnake wrote:

[quote=“n00bf0rlyf3, post:1, topic:362274”]if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("Regpure")) { if (starter == 0); addSkillXP(1000, 6); starter = 1; } else if (starter >= 1) { sM("You have already typed this command you noob."); }

Ok this is my command and when i type it, it allows me to type it again and again and again… How do I make it so I can only type it once?

I know it involves like public boolean savechar(); or something like that[/quote]
Im not really sure but maybe try

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("Regpure")) { if (starter == 0); addSkillXP(1000, 6); starter = 1; } else if (starter == 1) { sM("You have already typed this command you noob."); return false; }

Tell me if it works if it doesnt try

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("Regpure")) { if (starter == 0); addSkillXP(1000, 6); starter = 1; } else if (starter >= 1) { sM("You have already typed this command you noob."); return false; }

Read full topic
